Instructions and functions related specifically to the Amiga. Implementation will be done as
best as possible, yet, not all will be possible to emulate. Most of the instruction will
compile, yet have simply have no effect in runtime.
Set hardware register for hardware Sprite collision detection. No effect in AOZ.
Return collision status after a Set Hardcol instruction. No effect in AOZ.
Re-start automatic copper generation. May be implemented in a future enhanced Amiga renderer.
Stop automatic copper generation. May be implemented in a future enhanced Amiga renderer.
Swap logical and physical copper lists. May be implemented in a future enhanced Amiga renderer.
Re-set copper list pointer. May be implemented in a future enhanced Amiga renderer.
Insert a WAIT instruction into copper list. May be implemented in a future enhanced Amiga renderer.
Write a long MOVE instruction to copper list. May be implemented in a future enhanced Amiga renderer.
Write a MOVE instruction to current copper list. May be implemented in a future enhanced Amiga renderer.
Give address of logical copper list. May be implemented in a future enhanced Amiga renderer.
Used to handle multiple applications in the AMOS IDE. Will not be implemented.
managed multi-tasking on the Amiga. May be implemented.
Bring AMOS IDE in the front of display. Will not be implemented.
Bring AMOS IDE in the back of display. Will not be implemented.
Detect if AMOS is running. Emulation returns TRUE

return.text: True

descriptions.text: Changes the scale (zoom) of a bob

parameters.name: INDEX
parameters.text: Index of the bob in the list of active bobs

parameters.name: SCALEX#
parameters.text: Horizontal scale, 1 displays the bob at original size, 0.5 reduces it by half, 2 multiplies by two etc. Negative values will mirror the bob horizontally

parameters.name: SCALEY#
parameters.text: Vertical scale, 1 displays the bob at original size, 0.5 reduces it by half, 2 multiplies by two etc. Negative values will mirror the bob vertically

descriptions.text: Rotates a bob around it's hot-spot

parameters.name: INDEX

parameters.name: ANGLE#
parameters.text: Angle to rotate with, either in degrees or radian depending on the use of the "Degree" or "Radian" instruction. AOZ use radians by default

parameters.name: SKEWX#

Instructions set to play sounds effects.
BOOM command plays a realistic explosive sound effect.
This does not delay the program at all, so it may be necessary to use WAIT between successive explosions,
or to create ricochet and echo effects.
Generate percussive sound effect.
The SHOOT command generates a simple sound effect in exactly the same way as Boom.
Generate pure tone.
Unlike the built-in explosive sound effects, Bell produces a simple pure tone.

number of the required sample held in the bank. There is no limit to the number of samples that can be stored, other
than available memory.

descriptions.text: Turns on or off automatic sorting of the Z-order of the sprites in the current screen

Turns on the automatic sprite coordinate update system. After it, the effect of all "Sprite" instructions will be visible on display
Enforce a refresh of all the sprites on screen: all the modification to the coordinates and images of the sprite are reflected immediately on the screen
Changes the scale (zoom) of a sprite

parameters.name: INDEX
parameters.text: Index of the sprite in the list of active sprites

parameters.name: SCALEX#
parameters.text: Horizontal scale, 1 displays the Bob at original size, 0.5 reduces it by half, 2 multiplies by two etc. Negative values will mirror the sprite horizontally

parameters.name: SCALEY#
parameters.text: Vertical scale, 1 displays the Bob at original size, 0.5 reduces it by half, 2 multiplies by two etc. Negative values will mirror the sprite vertically

Description of the instruction.
You can play music and sound effects inside your AOZ programs, using the old MOD and XM file formats.
The main advantage of this type of file is its small size. You can store music on several voices as
well as sound effects. The AOZ instructions allow you to load and play your files.
AOZ uses the BassoonTracker Javascript library from Steffest, available under the MIT license.
Github: https://github.com/steffest/BassoonTracker
Enable the loop playing
Disable the loop playing
Load a module music file into a bank

parameters.text: The filename of the module to load

parameters.name: BANK
parameters.text: The bank to store the module loaded

parameters.name: PATTERN

Continue the current playing of the music module after a call of Track Stop instruction

Return the length of the current music module in number of patterns.
Return the number of channels of the current music module.
Return the number of the pattern in playing of the current music module.
Return the position into the pattern in playing of the current music module.
Set the global volume of the current music module.

descriptions.text: AOZ offers several instructions for managing connection interfaces.
A connection interface, called "Socket" allows the conversation between several remote computers.
Like a chat or a multiplayer game.
More informations on Web Socket API here: https://www.w3.org/TR/websockets/

pages.name: WebSocket Open

descriptions.text: Open a Web Socket channel, enabling you to send and receive messages and files

parameters.name: INDEX
parameters.text: Index of the channel

parameters.name: TAGS
parameters.text: Unused, for future expansion

pages.syntax: Websocket Open INDEX, URL$, PROTo COL$, TAGS$

descriptions.text: Destroys a WebSocket channel and all data associated

parameters.name: INDEX
parameters.text: Index of the channel

pages.name: WebSocket Send Message

descriptions.text: Send a message through a WebSocket channel

parameters.name: INDEX
parameters.text: Index of the channel

parameters.name: MESSAGE$
parameters.text: Message to send, no check on length.

parameters.name: TAG$
parameters.text: Unused, for future expansion

pages.syntax: Websocket Send Message INDEX, MESSAGE$, TAGS$

descriptions.text: Returns TRUE if a new message is available, FALSE if not

parameters.name: INDEX
parameters.text: Index of the channel

return.text: TRUE or FALSE if a new message is available

descriptions.text: Returns a newly arrived string message

parameters.name: INDEX
parameters.text: Index of the channel

return.text: The message

descriptions.text: Returns TRUE if a an error has occurred, FALSE if OK

descriptions.text: Instructions and functions to handle and detect zones
Erase the definition of a zone, making it non-detectable

parameters.name: INDEX
parameters.text: (Optional) The index of the zone to reset, if ommited all zones will be reset

descriptions.text: Return a magical string to use in the Print instruction when printing text, allowing you to define a zone around the text included as a parameter

parameters.name: TEXT$
parameters.text: The text to print, the zone will de defined from the top-left corner of the first character to the bottom-right corner of the last character. Warning: impredictible result if the text does not fit in one single line

parameters.name: INDEX
parameters.text: The index of the zone to set

pages.name: Set Zone

descriptions.text: Define a new zone in the current screen

parameters.name: INDEX
parameters.text: The index of the zone to set

parameters.name: X1
parameters.text: The horizontal coordinate of the top-left corner of the zone rectangle

parameters.name: Y1
parameters.text: The vertical coordinate of the top-left corner of the zone rectangle

parameters.name: X2
parameters.text: The horizontal coordinate of the bottom-right corner of the zone rectangle

parameters.name: Y2
parameters.text: The vertical coordinate of the bottom-right corner of the zone rectangle

pages.syntax: Set Zone NUMBER, X1, Y1 To X2, Y2

pages.name: Set Zone

descriptions.text: Define a new zone in the current screen

parameters.name: INDEX
parameters.text: The index of the zone to set

parameters.name: X
parameters.text: Horizontal coordinate of the top-left corner of the zone rectangle

parameters.name: Y
parameters.text: Vertical coordinate of the the top-left corner of the zone rectangle

parameters.name: WIDTH
parameters.text: Width of the zone rectangle

parameters.name: HEIGHT
parameters.text: Height of the zone rectangle

pages.syntax: Set Zone NUMBER, X1, Y1, WIDTH, HEIGHT

descriptions.text: Check if a given coordinate lays inside of a pre-defined zone

parameters.name: INDEX
parameters.text: The index of the zone to test

parameters.name: X
parameters.text: Horizontal coordinate to test

parameters.name: Y
parameters.text: Vertical coordinate to test

return.text: True if the given coordinate lay insid eof the zone, False if not

descriptions.text: Find the zone located at the given coordinates

parameters.name: X
parameters.text: Horizontal coordinate to test

parameters.name: Y
parameters.text: Vertical coordinate to test

return.text: -1 if the coordinate lay outside of every zones, index of the zone if they lay inside of one

descriptions.text: Check if a given hardware coordinate lay inside of a zone. Hardware coordinate are only different from screen coordinate for retro-machine emulation (Amiga, Atari etc.)

parameters.name: INDEX
parameters.text: The index of the zone to test

parameters.name: X
parameters.text: Horizontal hardware coordinate to test

parameters.name: Y
parameters.text: Vertical hardware coordinate to test

return.text: True if the given coordinate lay insid eof the zone, False if not

descriptions.text: Find the zone located at the given hardware coordinates. Hardware coordinate are only different from screen coordinate for retro-machine emulation (Amiga, Atari etc.)

parameters.name: X
parameters.text: Horizontal hardware coordinate to test

parameters.name: Y
parameters.text: Vertical hardware coordinate to test

return.text: -1 if the coordinate lay outside of every zones, index of the zone if they lay inside of one

descriptions.text: Return the index of a predefined zone (with "Set Zone") under the mouse

return.text: -1 if the coordinate lay outside of all the zones, or the index of the zone if they lay inside of one
